page.title: 05A HOUSEWIFE'S DAY
page.content: My name is Betty Frankland & I live at Whingroves Farm, Chop Gate. I am a housewife & farm worker on a small holding with my husband, Arthur. I get up at 7-30am. My first job is to go round the stock. We keep a herd of 50 cattle: 19 cows with calves at foot, the rest being young stirks. I spend about 1.5 hrs feeding cattle cake, hay and straw & checking the water. The cows are all chained up in byres & the calves run freely among them. The stirks run loose in sheds. After feeding them I clean the dung away from the cows standing, & then rebed them with clean straw. I do my housework until lunchtime, then I go back round the buildings to check & give more water. Then indoors cleaning & preparing our evening meal. At 3.30 pm I go out to the cattle & repeat the morning work to complete the day.
